Usually in a poignant but solemn manner.

Order

Pricing is a good topic. Everything considered (rarity, hype, condition, and the music itself), the pricing also reflects the time spent chasing down these records. Also included in the price is the number of shitty records I've bought in the gambling process of "discovering" something unknown.

If the record is listed on discogs, I list cheaper. If there are no other copies available online, I'll try to find a price where it can sell for more in the future.

I agree there is a sizeable speculativity, but I want to err on being conservative in my pricing.
